questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'monotonous'?
questions.explanation: Monotonous means repetitive and boring, lacking variety.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'viable'?
questions.explanation: Viable means capable of working successfully.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'rudimentary'?
questions.explanation: Rudimentary means involving only the simplest, most basic elements.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'transient'?
questions.explanation: Transient means lasting only for a short time.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'conspicuous'?
questions.explanation: Conspicuous means easily seen or attracting attention.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'scrutiny'?
questions.explanation: Scrutiny is close, careful examination of something.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'tedious'?
questions.explanation: Tedious describes something long, slow, and boring.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'saturate'?
questions.explanation: To saturate is to soak completely or fill to capacity.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'recur'?
questions.explanation: To recur is to happen again or repeatedly.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'allude'?
questions.explanation: To allude is to refer to something indirectly.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'whimsical'?
questions.explanation: Whimsical means fanciful or playfully unusual.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'vivid'?
questions.explanation: Vivid means bright, clear, or powerful in impact.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'stringent'?
questions.explanation: Stringent means very strict or firm.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'intricate'?
questions.explanation: Intricate describes something with many detailed and connected parts.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'inevitable'?
questions.explanation: Inevitable means certain to happen; unavoidable.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'precise'?
questions.explanation: Precise means exact and accurate.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'contemplate'?
questions.explanation: To contemplate is to think about something carefully and deeply.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'ample'?
questions.explanation: Ample means enough or more than enough; adequate or abundant.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'coincide'?
questions.explanation: To coincide is to occur at the same time or match closely.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'reliable'?
questions.explanation: Reliable means dependable and able to be trusted.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'impartial'?
questions.explanation: Impartial means fair and not taking sides.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'succinct'?
questions.explanation: Succinct means expressed clearly and briefly.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'elaborate'?
questions.explanation: Elaborate describes something with many details or complex design.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'bolster'?
questions.explanation: To bolster is to support or strengthen something.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'credible'?
questions.explanation: Credible means believable or convincing.
